ground_truth: Bernie backs out of the driveway and speeds along the road, gripping the steering wheel, while Jessica follows him, honking the horn desperately and running a red light. In the back garden, Molly hands her a glass of champagne, and there's a Crazy Golf windmill. Bernie floors Cal, and Jacob pulls Bernie off Cal, but Bernie punches Jacob, wrenches the sails off the windmill, and drops them. All four guys wrestle and struggle, tangled together, then fall. They sit on a wall side by side, David with an icepack on his cheek, as police officers arrive and then head off. Jacob laughs, and David and Bernie turn to look at Cal before the police officers leave. Emily takes a big sigh, and Hannah and Jessica stare at the ground. Bernie gets up, followed by Jessica who scurries after him, nervously running her fingers through her ponytail, as Robbie watches them go. He gets up and jogs around the corner after them, but then stops. Bernie limps slightly as they reach the end of the driveway, and Jessica glances back at Robbie, looking ashamed. Robbie turns away and shuffles back dejectedly, while the other three men remain sitting on the wall. Cal stands, Emily smiles bitterly while shaking her head, and Hannah frowns, her eyes filled with hurt. Emily gawks at Cal, and Hannah gives Jacob a small nod before he gets up. She wanders away, followed by Jacob, as Emily glares at Cal, and Molly comes out. Hannah and Jacob leave, and Robbie lets his head drop forward. With his brow furrowed, Cal looks down at the ground, and Emily eyes him angrily with her jaw clenched. Cal heads off, while Emily folds her arms. Cal approaches Robbie, who leans against the wall of the house. Cal smiles, nods, and leaves. Molly sits down on the garden steps, putting her head in her hand, as Cal lumbers down the driveway. At school, kids mill past Robbie, who sits alone on the stairs with his head bowed, and he presses Jessica's name on his phone's contact list. In her bedroom, Jessica lounges on her bed, staring into the distance. In Jacob's apartment, Hannah and Jacob are together, as Jacob holds out the phone to Hannah. Emily is at her desk in her office, writing, looking up and pouting sadly. At school, students pour out of the building, and Cal stands outside by his car, spotting Robbie, but Robbie eyes him balefully and walks off in another direction. Cal sits at the counter of a bar, his head resting on his hands, hunched with his head hung. He raises his head as Jacob sits next to him and scans the bar. The bartender sells Cal a shot and shrugs at Jacob. Cal and Jacob both stare down at the bar, and Jacob looks away.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Bernie withdraws from the driveway and accelerates along the street, clutching the steering wheel, while Jessica trails him, blaring the horn frantically and breaching a red light. In the rear garden, Molly passes her a flute of sparkling wine, and there's a Miniature Golf windmill. Bernie knocks Cal, and Jacob tugs Bernie off Cal, but Bernie strikes Jacob, yanks the vanes off the windmill, and lets them fall. All four fellows grapple and tussle, entwined together, then tumble. They rest on a barrier side by side, David with an icepack on his cheek, as police officers arrive and then depart. Jacob chuckles, and David and Bernie turn to glance at Cal before the police officers leave. Emily exudes a significant sigh, and Hannah and Jessica gaze at the ground. Bernie rises, followed by Jessica who scuttles after him, nervously running her fingers through her ponytail, as Robbie observes them depart. He rises and jogs around the corner after them, but then halts. Bernie limps slightly as they reach the end of the driveway, and Jessica peeks back at Robbie, looking ashamed. Robbie turns away and shuffles back disheartenedly, while the other three men remain seated on the barrier. Cal rises, Emily smiles bitterly while shaking her head, and Hannah frowns, her eyes filled with pain. Emily gawks at Cal, and Hannah gives Jacob a slight nod before he rises. She meanders away, followed by Jacob, as Emily glowers at Cal, and Molly emerges. Hannah and Jacob depart, and Robbie lets his head fall forward. With his brow creased, Cal gazes down at the ground, and Emily eyes him angrily with her jaw clenched. Cal departs, while Emily folds her arms. Cal approaches Robbie, who leans against the wall of the house. Cal grins, nods, and exits. Molly sits down on the garden steps, placing her head in her hand, as Cal trudges down the driveway. At school, kids mill past Robbie, who sits solitary on the stairs with his head bowed, and he taps Jessica's name on his phone's contact list. In her bedroom, Jessica reclines on her bed, staring into the distance. In Jacob's apartment, Hannah and Jacob are together, as Jacob extends the phone to Hannah. Emily is at her desk in her office, writing, looking up and pouting sadly. At school, students pour out of the building, and Cal stands outside by his car, spotting Robbie, but Robbie eyes him resentfully and walks off in another direction. Cal sits at the counter of a bar, his head resting on his hands, hunched with his head hung. He lifts his head as Jacob sits next to him and scans the bar. The bartender serves Cal a shot and shrugs at Jacob. Cal and Jacob both stare down at the bar, and Jacob looks away.

Bernie floors Cal, Jacob pulls him off, but Bernie punches Jacob and drops the windmill sails. All four wrestle and fall, sitting on a wall as police arrive. test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Bernie carefully backs out of the driveway, his foot pressing down on the accelerator as he speeds along the road, his hands gripping the steering wheel tightly. Meanwhile, Jessica is right behind him, following closely, honking the horn with a sense of urgency and desperation, even running a red light in her pursuit. In the back garden, Molly casually hands her a glass of champagne, and nearby stands a whimsical Crazy Golf windmill. In a sudden burst of aggression, Bernie floors Cal, and Jacob quickly intervenes, pulling Bernie off Cal. However, Bernie retaliates by punching Jacob, then forcefully wrenches the sails off the windmill and lets them drop to the ground. The four men become entangled in a chaotic struggle, wrestling and grappling with one another until they all collapse in a heap. Eventually, they find themselves sitting side by side on a wall, with David nursing his cheek with an icepack, as police officers arrive on the scene and then proceed to leave. Jacob bursts into laughter, prompting David and Bernie to turn their attention to Cal just as the police officers depart. Emily lets out a deep sigh, while Hannah and Jessica fix their gaze on the ground. Bernie rises to his feet, with Jessica quickly following suit, nervously running her fingers through her ponytail as she scurries after him, all under the watchful eyes of Robbie. He gets up and jogs around the corner in pursuit, but then comes to a halt. Bernie limps slightly as they reach the end of the driveway, and Jessica glances back at Robbie, her expression filled with shame. Robbie turns away, shuffling back with a dejected demeanor, while the other three men remain seated on the wall. Cal stands up, and Emily offers a bitter smile while shaking her head, as Hannah frowns, her eyes reflecting her hurt feelings. Emily gawks at Cal, and Hannah gives Jacob a small nod before he rises to his feet. She wanders away, with Jacob following her, as Emily continues to glare at Cal, and Molly emerges from the house. Hannah and Jacob make their exit, and Robbie lets his head drop forward in resignation. With his brow furrowed, Cal looks down at the ground, while Emily eyes him angrily, her jaw clenched in frustration. Cal eventually heads off, and Emily folds her arms defiantly. Cal approaches Robbie, who is leaning against the wall of the house. Cal offers a smile and a nod before leaving. Molly sits down on the garden steps, placing her head in her hand, as Cal lumbers down the driveway. At school, kids mill about, passing by Robbie, who sits alone on the stairs with his head bowed, and he presses Jessica's name on his phone's contact list. In her bedroom, Jessica lounges on her bed, her eyes staring into the distance. In Jacob's apartment, Hannah and Jacob are together, with Jacob holding out the phone to Hannah. Meanwhile, Emily is at her desk in her office, writing, occasionally looking up with a sad pout. At school, students pour out of the building, and Cal stands outside by his car, spotting Robbie, but Robbie gives him a baleful look and walks off in another direction. Cal finds himself sitting at the counter of a bar, his head resting on his hands, hunched over with his head hung low. He eventually raises his head as Jacob sits next to him, scanning the bar. The bartender sells Cal a shot and gives a nonchalant shrug to Jacob. Both Cal and Jacob stare down at the bar, lost in their thoughts, and Jacob eventually looks away.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
With deliberate care and attention, Bernie slowly backs out of the driveway, his foot steadily pressing down on the accelerator as he gains speed along the road. His hands are tightly gripping the steering wheel, indicating his heightened focus. At the same time, driving closely behind him is Jessica. She is following him with urgency and desperation, her hand continuously honking the horn, showing the intensity of her emotions, even daring to run a red light as she maintains her pursuit. Meanwhile, back in the garden, Molly nonchalantly hands a glass of champagne to her companion, and just nearby stands the whimsical and somewhat amusing Crazy Golf windmill, adding an air of quaint charm to the setting.

Suddenly, in a fit of aggression, Bernie lets loose his temper, flooring Cal to the ground. Quick to react, Jacob intervenes with haste, pulling Bernie off Cal to defuse the situation. However, Bernie doesn't back down and retaliates with a punch aimed at Jacob. In his rage, he forcefully wrenches the sails right off the windmill and lets them fall to the ground with a dramatic flourish. The four men then become intertwined in a chaotic struggle, wrestling and grappling vehemently with one another until they all collapse together in a tangled heap. Eventually, in the aftermath of their scuffle, they find themselves seated side by side on a nearby wall, with David nursing his sore cheek by applying an icepack. During this moment, police officers arrive on the scene, assessing the situation briefly before deciding to leave. As they depart, Jacob suddenly bursts into laughter, a sound that catches David's and Bernie's attention, causing them to turn their eyes toward Cal.

As the officers disappear from view, Emily releases a deep and weary sigh, while both Hannah and Jessica lower their eyes to the ground, consumed by introspection. Rising to his feet, Bernie is followed quickly by Jessica, who seems nervous as she runs her fingers through her ponytail, hurrying after him. This entire exchange unfolds under the watchful eyes of Robbie. He, too, rises and begins to jog around the corner in pursuit, only to come to an abrupt stop. Bernie, with a slight limp, reaches the end of the driveway, and Jessica casts a backward glance at Robbie, her expression filled with a palpable sense of shame. Robbie, in response, turns away, shuffling back with a dejected demeanor, while the remaining three men continue to sit on the wall. Cal eventually stands, with Emily offering a bitter smile as she shakes her head, while Hannah frowns, the reflection of hurt evident in her eyes.

Emily stares intensely at Cal, and Hannah gives Jacob a small nod before he also rises to his feet. She wanders away with Jacob trailing behind her, while Emily maintains her glaring focus on Cal. Molly emerges from the house to see the dwindling scene. As Hannah and Jacob make their way out, Robbie lowers his head forward, a sign of resignation. With his brow furrowed in contemplation, Cal looks down at the ground, and Emily's eyes remain fixed on him, filled with frustration as she clenches her jaw. Eventually, Cal turns to leave, while Emily defiantly crosses her arms. As Cal approaches Robbie, who is leaning against the wall of the house, he offers a smile and a nod before making his exit.

Molly takes a seat on the garden stairs, placing her head in her hand, a gesture of fatigue, as Cal lumbers down the driveway. At school, kids mill about, moving past Robbie, who sits alone on the stairs with his head bowed low. He taps Jessica's name on his phone's contact list, initiating a call. Meanwhile, in her bedroom, Jessica lounges on her bed, her eyes lost in thought as they stare into the distance. Over at Jacob's apartment, Hannah and Jacob are together, with Jacob holding his phone out towards Hannah, sharing a significant moment. Elsewhere, Emily sits at her desk in her office, her focus on writing, occasionally glancing up with a sad pout on her face. As school ends, students pour out of the building, with Cal standing outside by his car. He spots Robbie, but Robbie returns his gaze with a baleful look before choosing to walk off in another direction.

Later, Cal finds himself sitting at the counter of a bar, his head resting heavily on his hands, his posture hunched over, burdened by his thoughts. Eventually, he raises his head just as Jacob appears beside him, scanning the surroundings of the bar. The bartender casually slides Cal a shot and gives a nonchalant shrug in response to Jacob. Both Cal and Jacob then gaze down at the bar, each lost in their thoughts, pondering over the events that unfolded, until Jacob eventually looks away, breaking the silence.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Bernie carefully maneuvers his car in reverse, backing out of the driveway with precision before accelerating down the road, his hands gripping the steering wheel tightly. Meanwhile, Jessica, determined to catch up with him, follows closely behind, her car horn blaring in desperation as she recklessly runs a red light in pursuit. In the back garden, Molly extends her arm to hand a glass of champagne to someone, and nearby stands a Crazy Golf windmill, its sails turning gently in the breeze. In a sudden burst of aggression, Bernie forcefully knocks Cal to the ground, prompting Jacob to intervene by pulling Bernie away from Cal. However, Bernie retaliates by delivering a punch to Jacob and, in a fit of anger, he wrenches the sails off the windmill and lets them fall to the ground. The four men become entangled in a chaotic struggle, wrestling and grappling with one another until they all collapse in a heap. Eventually, they manage to disentangle themselves and sit side by side on a wall, with David nursing a bruise on his cheek with an icepack. As police officers arrive on the scene, they assess the situation before deciding to leave. Jacob breaks into laughter, causing David and Bernie to turn their heads to look at Cal, who remains silent as the officers depart. Emily releases a deep sigh, while Hannah and Jessica fix their gazes on the ground, lost in thought. Bernie rises to his feet, prompting Jessica to quickly follow, her fingers nervously running through her ponytail as Robbie watches them leave. He then stands and jogs around the corner in an attempt to catch up, but ultimately comes to a halt. Bernie, now limping slightly, reaches the end of the driveway with Jessica, who glances back at Robbie with a look of shame. Robbie, feeling dejected, turns away and shuffles back, leaving the other three men seated on the wall. Cal stands up, and Emily offers a bitter smile while shaking her head, as Hannah frowns, her eyes reflecting her hurt feelings. Emily stares at Cal with disbelief, and Hannah gives Jacob a small nod of acknowledgment before he rises to his feet. She begins to wander away, with Jacob following closely behind, as Emily continues to glare at Cal, and Molly emerges from the house. Hannah and Jacob make their exit, and Robbie lets his head drop forward in resignation. Cal, with a furrowed brow, looks down at the ground, while Emily glares at him angrily, her jaw clenched in frustration. Cal eventually decides to leave, and Emily folds her arms, watching him go. Cal approaches Robbie, who is leaning against the wall of the house, and offers a smile and a nod before departing. Molly takes a seat on the garden steps, resting her head in her hand, as Cal makes his way down the driveway. At school, Robbie sits alone on the stairs, his head bowed as kids mill past him, and he presses Jessica's name on his phone's contact list, hoping for a connection. In her bedroom, Jessica lounges on her bed, her eyes staring into the distance, lost in thought. In Jacob's apartment, Hannah and Jacob are together, and Jacob holds out the phone to Hannah, offering it to her. Meanwhile, Emily sits at her desk in her office, writing with a pen, occasionally looking up with a sad pout on her lips. As students pour out of the school building, Cal stands outside by his car, his eyes scanning the crowd until he spots Robbie, who meets his gaze with a baleful look before walking off in another direction. Cal finds himself at the counter of a bar, his head resting on his hands, hunched over with his head hung low. He eventually raises his head as Jacob takes a seat next to him, his eyes scanning the bar for any sign of familiarity. The bartender approaches, selling Cal a shot and offering a nonchalant shrug to Jacob. Both Cal and Jacob stare down at the bar, lost in their thoughts, until Jacob eventually looks away, leaving Cal to his solitude.

In the back garden, Molly hands her a glass of champagne near a Crazy Golf windmill. Bernie floors Cal, leading to a scuffle where Jacob pulls Bernie off Cal, but Bernie retaliates by punching Jacob and dismantling the windmill's sails. As students exit the school, Cal spots Robbie, who avoids him and walks away. Cal sits at a bar counter, head in hands, until Jacob joins him. The bartender serves Cal a shot and shrugs at Jacob. test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Bernie backs out of the driveway, a suburban street lined with maple trees known for their vibrant autumn foliage, and speeds along the road, gripping the steering wheel of his vintage red Mustang, while Jessica follows him, honking the horn desperately and running a red light, her car narrowly missing a passing cyclist. In the back garden, known for its award-winning rose bushes, Molly hands her a glass of champagne, and there's a Crazy Golf windmill, painted brightly by neighborhood kids during a summer project. Bernie floors Cal during an argument that began over an old rivalry from high school, and Jacob pulls Bernie off Cal, but Bernie punches Jacob, wrenches the sails off the windmill, and drops them in frustration. All four guys wrestle and struggle, tangled together, then fall into the flower bed, crushing the hydrangeas. They sit on a garden wall side by side, David with an icepack on his cheek from the scuffle, as police officers arrive, having been called by concerned neighbors, and then head off after a brief chat. Jacob laughs, trying to lighten the mood, and David and Bernie turn to look at Cal before the police officers leave. Emily takes a big sigh, overwhelmed by the chaotic scene, and Hannah and Jessica stare at the ground, contemplating the aftermath. Bernie gets up, particularly aware of his twisted ankle, followed by Jessica who scurries after him, nervously running her fingers through her ponytail, as Robbie, hidden partially by the shade of a large oak, watches them go. He gets up and jogs around the corner after them, curious but uncertain, but then stops, feeling the weight of the day’s events. Bernie limps slightly as they reach the end of the driveway, where an old swing set rusts silently, and Jessica glances back at Robbie, looking ashamed over her earlier reckless driving. Robbie turns away and shuffles back dejectedly, while the other three men remain sitting on the wall, a silent testament to their shared history. Cal stands, Emily smiles bitterly while shaking her head, remembering happier times, and Hannah frowns, her eyes filled with hurt from recent revelations. Emily gawks at Cal, recalling an old grudge, and Hannah gives Jacob a small nod before he gets up, signaling an agreement to talk later. She wanders away, followed by Jacob, as Emily glares at Cal, and Molly comes out, curious about the commotion. Hannah and Jacob leave, and Robbie lets his head drop forward, feeling the burden of fractured friendships. With his brow furrowed, Cal looks down at the ground, and Emily eyes him angrily with her jaw clenched, considering the consequences of their actions. Cal heads off, while Emily folds her arms, determined to maintain her stance. Cal approaches Robbie, who leans against the wall of the house, its bricks aged and crumbling, showing their years. Cal smiles, nods in an attempt to mend bridges, and leaves. Molly sits down on the garden steps, putting her head in her hand, exasperated by the ongoing drama, as Cal lumbers down the driveway. At school, a sprawling campus known for its academic excellence, kids mill past Robbie, who sits alone on the stairs with his head bowed, feeling isolated, and he presses Jessica's name on his phone's contact list, seeking reconciliation. In her bedroom, decorated with band posters and fairy lights, Jessica lounges on her bed, staring into the distance, lost in thought. In Jacob's apartment, located near the downtown area, Hannah and Jacob are together, as Jacob holds out the phone to Hannah, sharing a picture that might bring them closer. Emily is at her desk in her office, cluttered with papers and a coffee mug half-full, writing, looking up and pouting sadly as she reflects on the day's events. At school, students pour out of the building, chattering about the upcoming weekend, and Cal stands outside by his car, a second-hand sedan with a dented fender, spotting Robbie, but Robbie eyes him balefully and walks off in another direction, still angry. Cal sits at the counter of a bar, the regular haunt of locals, his head resting on his hands, hunched with his head hung, pondering his next move. He raises his head as Jacob sits next to him and scans the bar, noting the familiar faces and the bartender who has seen many a story unfold. The bartender sells Cal a shot and shrugs at Jacob, acknowledging the night's tension. Cal and Jacob both stare down at the bar, and Jacob looks away, considering what lies ahead.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: Bernie backs out of the driveway and speeds along the road gripping the steering wheel while Jessica follows him honking the horn desperately and running a red light. In the back garden Molly hands her a glass of champagne and there is a Crazy Golf windmill. Bernie floors Cal and Jacob pulls Bernie off Cal but Bernie punches. Jacob wrenches the sails off the windmill and drops them. All four guys wrestle and struggle tangled together then fall. They sit on a wall side by side. David with an icepack on his cheek as police officers arrive and then head off. Jacob laughs and David and Bernie turn to look at Cal before the police officers leave. Emily takes a big sigh and Hannah and Jessica stare at the ground. Bernie gets up followed by Jessica who scurries after him nervously running her fingers through her ponytail as Robbie watches them go. He gets up and jogs around the corner after them but then stops. Bernie limps slightly as they reach the end of the driveway and Jessica glances back at Robbie looking ashamed. Robbie turns away and shuffles back dejectedly while the other three men remain sitting on the wall. Cal stands. Emily smiles bitterly while shaking her head and Hannah frowns her eyes filled with hurt. Emily gawks at Cal and Hannah gives Jacob a small nod before he gets up. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. With his brow furrowed Cal looks down at the ground and Emily eyes him angrily with her jaw clenched. Cal heads off while Emily folds her arms. Cal approaches Robbie who leans against the wall of the house. Cal smiles nods and leaves. Molly sits down on the garden steps putting her head in her hand as Cal lumbers down the driveway. At school kids mill past Robbie who sits alone on the stairs with his head bowed and he presses Jessica's name on his phone's contact list. In her bedroom Jessica lounges on her bed staring into the distance. In Jacob's apartment Hannah and Jacob are together as Jacob holds out the phone to Hannah. The bartender sells Cal a shot and shrugs at Jacob. Cal and Jacob both stare down at the bar and Jacob looks away.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: Bernie backs out of the driveway and speeds along the road gripping the steering wheel while Jessica follows him honking the horn desperately and running a red light. In the back garden Molly hands her a glass of champagne and there is a Crazy Golf windmill. Bernie floors Cal and Jacob pulls Bernie off Cal but Bernie punches. Jacob wrenches the sails off the windmill and drops them. All four guys wrestle and struggle tangled together then fall. They sit on a wall side by side. David with an icepack on his cheek as police officers arrive and then head off. Jacob laughs and David and Bernie turn to look at Cal before the police officers leave. Emily takes a big sigh and Hannah and Jessica stare at the ground. Bernie gets up followed by Jessica who scurries after him nervously running her fingers through her ponytail as Robbie watches them go. He gets up and jogs around the corner after them but then stops. Bernie limps slightly as they reach the end of the driveway and Jessica glances back at Robbie looking ashamed. Robbie turns away and shuffles back dejectedly while the other three men remain sitting on the wall. Cal stands. Emily smiles bitterly while shaking her head and Hannah frowns her eyes filled with hurt. Emily gawks at Cal and Hannah gives Jacob a small nod before he gets up. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Sam rolls forward onto the sidewalk and gallops down the alley, clutching the bicycle handlebars, while Lisa mirrors him, yanking the doorbell eagerly and hopping over the sidewalk crack. In the rooftop garden, Tina tosses her a bucket of cola, and there's a Ferris wheel carousel. Sam flattens Eli, and Max yanks Sam off Eli, but Sam kicks Max, rips the spokes from the carousel, and tosses them. All four cats scuffle and resist, twisted together, then tumble. They lean against a fence side by side, Mike with a bandage on his forehead, as firefighters appear and then fly away. Max chuckles, and Mike and Sam pivot to glance at Eli before the firefighters vanish. Vera draws a deep breath, and Cindy and Lisa fixate on the sky. Sam rises, shadowed by Lisa who dashes after him, anxiously twirling her bracelet, as Tony observes them depart. He rises and skips around the lamppost after them, but then halts. Sam inches slightly as they arrive at the edge of the sidewalk, and Lisa peeks back at Tony, appearing guilty. Tony pivots and trudges back forlornly, while the other three cats remain leaning against the fence. Eli ascends, Vera smirks sadly while shaking her head, and Cindy scowls, her eyes brimming with sorrow. Vera gawks at Eli, and Cindy offers Max a faint nod before he rises. She ambles away, followed by Max, as Vera leers at Eli, and Tina emerges. Cindy and Max exit, and Tony lets his head droop forward. With his brow knitted, Eli gazes down at the pavement, and Vera regards him coldly with her lips firm. Eli departs, while Vera crosses her arms. Eli approaches Tony, who slouches against the trunk of the tree. Eli grins, nods, and departs. Tina perches on the porch steps, resting her head in her hand, as Eli shambles down the sidewalk. At the market, kids wander past Tony, who sits alone on the bench with his head lowered, and he taps Lisa's name on his phone's directory. In her attic, Lisa reclines on her couch, gazing into the void. In Max's studio, Cindy and Max are together, as Max extends the phone to Cindy. Vera is at her workstation in her lab, scribbling, looking up and pouting sullenly. At the market, shoppers drift out of the stalls, and Eli lingers outside by his scooter, noticing Tony, but Tony regards him suspiciously and strides off in a different path. Eli rests at the table of a café, his head leaning on his elbows, slouched with his head downcast. He lifts his head as Max settles beside him and surveys the café. The server hands Eli a dessert and shrugs at Max. Eli and Max both scrutinize the table, and Max diverts his gaze.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Bernie speeds along the road, followed by Jessica who desperately honks and runs a red light. In the garden, Molly hands someone champagne near a Crazy Golf windmill. Bernie fights Cal, with Jacob intervening, but Bernie punches Jacob and dismantles the windmill. The four men wrestle and fall; they later sit on a wall, as police arrive and leave. Jessica follows Bernie, fraught with nerves, while Robbie watches. Bernie limps at the driveway's end, Jessica ashamedly glances back at Robbie, who walks away dejectedly. The other men remain seated. Cal stands; Emily and Hannah show mixed emotions. Emily glares at Cal, who then approaches Robbie, nods, and leaves, as Molly sits on the steps. At school, isolated Robbie considers texting Jessica. Jessica is pensive in her bedroom, while Hannah and Jacob are together at his apartment. In her office, Emily writes sadly. As students leave school, Cal spots Robbie, but Robbie ignores him. Cal, dejected at a bar, sits with Jacob, both reflecting silently.
